A bibliography of Tolkien studies

All references in Modern Language Association style

© Le Dragon de Brume

2025-12-20 00:43:08

CC BY-SA 4.0

☰ Books & Reviews All references (MLA) All references (Chicago)

This view lists all references currently present in the bibliography. The citation style used is MLA (Modern Language Association), but modified as follows:

  • Subsequent authors are not replaced by em-dashes, but are listed with their full name. — So you can copy a reference without having to supply any missing information.
  • The number of authors is not limited (whereas standard MLA style would use an “et al.” after the first author if there are more than three authors). — So you can know all authors here, but do not forget to re-apply the MLA rules if you intend to use the reference in a paper strictly adhering to the MLA style.
  • Rules for demoting non-dropping name particles are slightly changed to the editor’s taste.
  • The collection title (for series, etc.) is included, when available.
Abaléa, Gaëlle. “Death as a Gift in J. R. R. Tolkien’s Work and Buffy the Vampire Slayer.” Journal of Tolkien Research, vol. 10, no. 1, 2020, https://scholar.valpo.edu/journaloftolkienresearch/vol10/iss1/7.
Abaléa, Gaëlle. “Transmission: an escape from death in Tolkien’s work?” Death and Immortality in Middle-earth, edited by Daniel Helen, Luna Press Publishing, 2017. Peter Roe Memorial Booklet no. 17.
Abbott, Joe. “Tolkien’s Monsters: Concept and Function in The Lord of the Rings (Part 1) The Balrog of Khazad-dum.” Mythlore, vol. 16, no. 1 (59), Autumn 1989, pp. 19–26, 33, https://www.jstor.org/stable/26812101.
Abbott, Joe. “Tolkien’s Monsters: Concept and Function in The Lord of the Rings (Part 2) Shelob the Great.” Mythlore, vol. 16, no. 2 (60), Winter 1989, pp. 40–47, https://www.jstor.org/stable/26811891.
Abbott, Joe. “Tolkien’s Monsters: Concept and Function in The Lord of the Rings (Part 3) Sauron.” Mythlore, vol. 16, no. 3 (61), Spring 1990, pp. 51–59, https://www.jstor.org/stable/26813006.
Abbott, John B. “Flaws in the Tapestry of The Lord of the Rings.” Mallorn: The Journal of the Tolkien Society, no. 5, April 1972, pp. 9–10, https://journals.tolkiensociety.org/mallorn/article/view/268.
Abbott, John B. “J. R. R. Tolkien: A Bibliography.” Mallorn: The Journal of the Tolkien Society, no. 3, May 1971, pp. 3–4, https://journals.tolkiensociety.org/mallorn/article/view/261.
Åberg, Magnus. “An Analysis of Dwarvish.” Arda Philology, vol. 1, 2007, pp. 42–65.
Abrahamson, Megan B. “J. R. R. Tolkien, Fanfiction, and ‘the Freedom of the Reader.’” Mythlore, vol. 32, no. 1 (123), 2013, pp. 53–72, https://www.jstor.org/stable/26815846.
Acker, Paul. “A Rabble of Uninvited Dwarves.” Tolkien Studies, no. 19, 2022, pp. 9–37, https://doi.org/10.1353/tks.2022.0010.
Acker, Paul. “Tolkien’s Sellic Spell: A Beowulfian Fairy Tale.” Tolkien Studies, no. 13, 2016, pp. 31–44, https://doi.org/10.1353/tks.2016.0005.
Adams, Robert M. “The Hobbit Habit.” Tolkien: New Critical Perspectives, edited by Neil D. Isaacs and Rose A. Zimbardo, The University Press of Kentucky, 1981.
Adam, Virginie. “Fantasy et boréalisme. Smaug, une étude de cas.” Études Germaniques, no. 290, 2018, pp. 255–265, https://doi.org/10.3917/eger.290.0255.
“Addenda and Corrigenda to Bibliography (in English) for 2003.” Tolkien Studies, no. 3, 2006, p. 276, https://doi.org/10.1353/tks.2006.0001.
Adderley, C. M. “Meeting Morgan le Fay: J. R. R. Tolkien’s Theory of Subcreation and the Secondary World of Sir Gawain and the Green Knight.” Mythlore, vol. 22, no. 4 (86), Spring 2000, pp. 48–58, https://www.jstor.org/stable/26814532.
Agan, Cami D. “An Account of a Lost Geography: ‘Of Beleriand and Its Realms.’” Journal of the Fantastic in the Arts, vol. 30, no. 1, 2019, pp. 85–102.
Agan, Cami D., editor. Cities and Strongholds of Middle-earth: Essays on the Habitations of Tolkien’s Legendarium. Mythopoeic Press, 2024.
Agan, Cami D. “Germanic Heroes, Courage, and Fate: Northern Narratives of J. R. R. Tolkien’s Legendarium by Richard Gallant (review).” Mythlore, vol. 44, no. 1 (147), 2025, pp. 271–277, https://www.jstor.org/stable/48840397.
Agan, Cami D. “Grounding and Traversing the Great Tales: Elven Strongholds of Beleriand.” Cities and Strongholds of Middle-earth, edited by Cami D. Agan, Mythopoeic Press, 2024.
Agan, Cami D. “Hearkening to the Other: a Certeauvian Reading of the Ainulindalë.” Mythlore, vol. 34, no. 1 (127), 2015, pp. 117–138, https://www.jstor.org/stable/26815795.
Agan, Cami D. “Legal Precedent and Noldorin History: Miriel’s Weaving.” Loremasters and Libraries in Fantasy and Science Fiction, edited by Jason Fisher and Janet Brennan Croft, Mythopoeic Press, 2022.
Agan, Cami D. “Lúthien Tinúviel and Bodily Desire in the Lay of Leithian.” Perilous and Fair: Women in the Works and Life of J. R. R. Tolkien, edited by Janet Brennan Croft and Leslie A. Donovan, Mythopoeic Press, 2015.
Agan, Cami D. “Song as Mythic Conduit in The Fellowship of the Ring.” Mythlore, vol. 26, no. 3/4 (101/102), 2008, pp. 41–63, https://www.jstor.org/stable/26814584.
Agan, Cami D. “The First Age Materials: Christopher Tolkien’s Greatest Task.” Adapting Tolkien, edited by Will Sherwood, Luna Press Publishing, 2021. Peter Roe Memorial Booklet no. 20.
Agan, Cami D., David Bratman, Tom Emanuel, Jonathan Evans, Jason Fisher, and John Magoun. “The Year’s Work in Tolkien Studies 2021.” Tolkien Studies, no. 21, 2024, pp. 267–330, https://doi.org/10.1353/tks.2024.a973849.
Agan, Cami D., David Bratman, Kate Neville, Jennifer Rogers, Jonathan Evans, John Wm. Houghton, and John Magoun. “The Year’s Work in Tolkien Studies 2020.” Tolkien Studies, no. 20, 2023, pp. 229–297, https://doi.org/10.1353/tks.2023.a934076.
Agnoloni, Giovanni. “Tolkien as a Benchmark of Comparative Literature — Middle-earth in Our World.” The Ring Goes Ever On, edited by Sarah Wells, The Tolkien Society, 2008.

Agøy, Nils Ivar. “A Question of Style: On Translating The Silmarillion into Norwegian.” 2003. Tolkien in Translation, edited by Thomas Honegger, Walking Tree Publishers, 2011. Cormarë Series no. 4.
Agøy, Nils Ivar. “Mr. Bliss: The Precursor of a Precursor?” Mallorn: The Journal of the Tolkien Society, no. 20, September 1983, pp. 25–27, https://journals.tolkiensociety.org/mallorn/article/view/337.
Agøy, Nils Ivar. “Quid Hinieldus cum Christo? New Perspectives on Tolkien’s Theological Dilemma and his Sub-Creation Theory.” Mallorn: The Journal of the Tolkien Society, no. 33, 1995, pp. 31–38.
Agøy, Nils Ivar. “The Christian Tolkien: A Response to Ronald Hutton.” The Ring and the Cross: Christianity and The Lord of the Rings, edited by Paul E. Kerry, Fairleigh Dickinson University Press, 2011.
Agøy, Nils Ivar. “The Degradation of ‘IS’: The Shores of Middle-earth by Robert Giddings, Elizabeth Holland (review).” Mythlore, vol. 10, no. 1 (35), Spring 1983, pp. 35–37, https://www.jstor.org/stable/26810626.
Agøy, Nils Ivar. “The Dim Echo of the Catcher.” Proceedings of the Tolkien 2019 Conference, edited by Will Sherwood, Luna Press Publishing, 2025.
Agøy, Nils Ivar. “The Spirit of Wickedness, Tolkien and the Spirit of the Age.” Lembas Extra 1987, edited by Renée Vink and Arti Ponsen, 1987, pp. 21–33.

Agøy, Nils Ivar. “Vague or Vivid?: Descriptions in The Lord of the Rings.” Tolkien Studies, no. 10, 2013, pp. 49–67, https://doi.org/10.1353/tks.2013.0011.
Agøy, Nils Ivar. “Viewpoints, Audiences and Lost Texts in The Silmarillion.” The Silmarillion Thirty Years On, edited by Allan Turner, Walking Tree Publishers, 2007. Cormarë Series no. 15.
Ahn, Joyce. “Critical Responses to Peter Jackson’s The Lord of the Rings Film Trilogy.” Critical Insights: The Lord of the Rings, edited by Robert C. Evans, Salem Press, 2022, p. 117.

Airiau, Paul. “La chute de Gandalf dans la Moria.” Tolkien, trente ans après (1973–2003), edited by Vincent Ferré, Christian Bourgois, 2004.
Alberto, Maria K. “‘And stooping he raised Beleg and kissed his mouth’: Queering Canon with Tolkien Fanfiction.” Queer Approaches to Tolkien, edited by Robin A. Reid, Christopher Vaccaro, and Stephen Yandell, McFarland, 2025, p. 189.
Alberto, Maria K. “A Sense of Tales Untold: Exploring the Edges of Tolkien’s Literary Canvas by Peter Grybauskas (review).” Tolkien Studies, no. 19, 2022, pp. 216–219, https://doi.org/10.1353/tks.2022.0022.
Alberto, Maria K. “‘It had been his virtue, and therefore also the cause of his fall’: Seduction as a Mythopoeic Accounting for Evil in Tolkien’s Work.” Mythlore, vol. 35, no. 2 (130), 2017, pp. 63–79, https://www.jstor.org/stable/26816085.
Alberto, Maria K. “‘The effort to translate’: Fan Film Culture and the Works of J. R. R. Tolkien.” Journal of Tolkien Research, vol. 3, no. 3, 2016, https://scholar.valpo.edu/journaloftolkienresearch/vol3/iss3/2.
